LONDON E.C.4 There is an item reading ' 4 TONS WOOLLEN PIECEGOODS” in our above mentioned application and requesting you to allow shiiping space for this item to our friends:- MESSRS ARTHUR E.EVANS & CO. Bahrain No-.r Dear Sir: REF.OUR APPLICATION FOR SHIPPING SPACE FOR 13 TONS IN FAVOUR OF MESSRS UNITED I AFRICAN CO. LONDON E.C.4. MANCHESTER• and shiiping space may kindly be allotted to them instead of Messrs United African Co. Messrs Haber Company, Manchester are well in a position to supply the goods, reference their cable of the 4th July 1945 attached herewith in origin. Bahrain. tober 1945 Dear Sir: Kef. your No.2809-56/43 °f 9«7.45 and 3850-36/43(a) of 18.^.45 We have been advised by the Suppliers Basrah Office Messrs African and Eastern (Near East)Ltd.| letter No.1518 of the 11th instant to the effect that their London Office has still not received the advise regarding shipping space from India Office who advised Messrs United Africa Co., London., to the effect that they have heard nothing from the Government of i India. If it is possible please do the needful by cable as the goods are waiting to be shipped. We shall be glad to meet with the cable charges. Yours faithfullyEXPRESS LETTER [N % B % —This is an ORIGINAL MESSAGE, sent by post to save telegraphic expense and undue use of the mres, intended to be treated, on receipt, with the same expedition as if it haa been telegraphed. To save time and formalities it is worded and signed as if it had been so despatched,] From Political, Bahrain. To Britain, Bushiro . / z \ > i ~y No. <5 0 -36/43(a). Dated c3^ 193 . Reference my Express Letter No. 2309-36/43 of 9th July, 1946 and your Express Letter No. 3264-79/175A of 9th August, 1946 to Foreign, Now Delhi. Piece-goods from the Tfriited Kingdom. 2. The exporters, Messrs. United African Company, London have informed the importers, Messrs. Yousuf Abdulrahman Fakhroo, Bahrain, that the India Office have received no recommendation from the Govcmnent of India. 3 . Grateful to know whether this consignment has been recommended by the Government of India. - POLITICAL - x-x-x-x-x-x-x-x The issue of the above has been authorised. J. The Government of India recommended import assistance to the India Office on the 26th September, 1945. (r~h- for political Agent, Bahrain. h? MNo.PA/FC/# H.B.Lr* s Political Bahrain* OFi ICE OF THE FOOD CONTROLLER, BAHRAIN: Agent, Ll ELQRANDU h • ~ Woollen Suitings from U ,!;. A consignment of woollen suitings will shortly be available fur sale locally and I am informed that Hr.Sadary, the tailor, has made tentative arrangements for purchasing same. io enable the general puDlic check Lr* Sadary’s price per suit, I shalj. be grateful, in the event of his making the purchase, for permission to advise the public the type of cloth ano price per yard which will be available at Salary’ 1 s. The present system arranged at a Merchants' Advisory Committee meeting, does not allow me to divulge to whom the goods belong* FOOD CONTROLLER.No. 1323 - 36/43(a). POLITICAL AGENCY, BAHRAIN. The 28th April 1946. To MEMORANDUM The Food Controller, Bahrain. Reference your memorandum No.PA/FC/8, dated the 24th April 1946. 2. You are authorised to take the action suggested in the second paragraph of your memorandum under reference, and to reveal, in future, the names of the persons to v/hora goods belong. \mI for POLITICAL AGENT, BAHRAIN. Received New Delhi, the 8th January, 1946. Telegram I. £. C . 9679. From India Supply Commission. Wool yarn. Allocation for November 1945 - February 1946 period for India is 200,000 pound (half of 400,000). In addition to allocation of 2,000 pound (half of 4,000) made to Persian Gulf territory. Agent, Bahrain* MEMORANDUM OFI'ICE OF THE FOOD CONTROLLER, ^5) A further 641 yards Black Woollen Aba material of expensive quality has arrived here from the U.K. per ss MORESBY' • I shall be grateful if you will kindly authorise me to sell same on permits in the same manner as the previous consign ment and to those persons, who did not obtain their requiremen s^ FOOD CONTROLLER.Q-nw No.1768-36/43(a) POLITICAL AGENCY, ' BAHRAIN• DATED mn JUNE, 1946. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 36/43 A Import of Woollen Goods from U.K.'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 50; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-48; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains copies of applications for shipping space that were submitted to the Political Agency by a number of merchants in Bahrain. The applications all relate to the import of woollen goods from the United Kingdom.The file also contains a small number of short letters to the Political Agency from these merchants that were attached to their applications.
